atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the @tailwind directive to insert Tailwind’s `base`, `components`, `utilities`, and `screens` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use @apply to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the @theme directive to define your project's custom design tokens, like fonts, colors, and breakpoints

references.name: Learn more about customizing your theme in the theme variables documentation

atDirectives.name: @plugin
atDirectives.description: Use the @plugin directive to load a legacy JavaScript-based plugin.The @plugin directive accepts either a package name or a local path.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Use the @custom-variant directive to add a custom variant in your project.

atDirectives.name: @source
atDirectives.description: Use the @source directive to explicitly specify source files that aren't picked up by Tailwind's automatic content detection.
